result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A. Bach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Hate Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Hate Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay costs in the amount of $243.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
 Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.

Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the DOC.
Defendant shall not have any contact of any kind with Carlos Luevano-Arellano or Rafael D. Hernandez-Garcia.
Defendant shall undergo an alcohol assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
case called at 1:06 PM.
Attorney Richard Russell Mccue appeared by phone means for Defendant Daniel A. Bach. Prosecuting Atty Katherine Findley appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Daniel A. Bach not in court.
Attorney McCue informs the court an offer was made and moves to continue for resolution.
So ordered.
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 9:18 AM.
Defendant Daniel A. Bach in court in custody and with attorney Richard Russell Mccue.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney McCue informs the court this matter is close to resolution and moves for a plea and sentencing date.
Defendant enters a plea of "NOT GUILTY" on all counts.
No objection by the state.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 10:06 AM.
Defendant Daniel A. Bach in court, in custody.  Attorney Bucher appears for intake purpose only for today's hearing.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court reads charge portion onto the record.
State requests $1,000.00 signature bond (No contact Juan Carlos Luevano-Arellano)
So ordered.
Court moves to quash warrant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Juan Carlos Luevano-Arellano.

Case called at 9:36 AM.
No appearance.
State moves for warrant "BODY ONLY" State of Wisconsin.
So ordered.
